intro: Linaria badalii, commonly known as the Badalii toadflax, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular in shape with two lips, a feature common in many species of the genus Linaria. Linaria badalii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
